content.p: This is my personal homepage at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam where I'm currently a third year's student Computer Science. My main interests there are theoretical computer science and software technology.

img.alt: A picture of Loes and Martijn

content.p: You can see what I look like on the picture above. I'm the one on the right, my girlfriend Loes is on the left.
In spring 2005, I'm practicum assistant for the course Inleiding Theoretische Informatica. More information can be found on a separate page for this course.

Currently I'm mostly interested in logic in computer science (inspired by the course Advanced Logic, this book on Gödel's work, and Helle Hansen's thesis, among others) and the theory and practice of programming languages (e.g. paradigms, compilers, semantics).

On a less theoretical note, I'm amusing myself playing with LaTeX (the typesetting one that is), the Debian operating system, and small “never-to-finish” programming projects (at the moment focussing on Python and XSLT).

ul.li: Concepts, Techniques, and Models of Computer Programming by Peter van Roy and Seif Haridi.
Denotational Semantics: A Methodology for Language Development by David Schmidt.
On Understanding Types, Data Abstraction, and Polymorphism by Luca Cardelli and Peter Wegner.

content.p: Whenever there's still time left in my day, I try to spend it with my girlfriend Loes, family, or friends. When I'm alone, I try to play some guitar (although Loes is still unimpressed by my playing skills), and listen to music. My alltime favourite band is Sonic Youth. Naming other good artists after them would result in a infinite list, and since I'm lazy, I won't do so until you ask me.
The main contents of my homepage are accessible through the navigation at the bottom of every page. All pages related to my study at university are located in the vu subdirectory.
More info about this website, including the source code, can be found on the colofon page.
If you experience problems reading these pages, please try a decent browser.
